I'm going to change my review again. negative to positive back to negative.

Let me start by saying, this is my favorite game on steam, enjoy it a lot, as can be told by the amount of hours in it.

So why down vote...simple, the DEVs do not care about the community!!

You play killer, it's so brutal cause you will be forced to play high ranked players cause of a lack of killers. The DEVs would rather get survivors into matches asap, which forces low ranked killers against high ranked survivors. Now rank doesn't matter in this game, but that's more for survivor than killer.

Play solo survivor, worst part of the game, people will do gens before friends. They will save sprint burst over save..so that sucks.

Great game if you play SWF, but the whole community is aware SWF is kind of the problem, but what can you do.. i dunno.

Fun game to play with friends, but I'd hate to start playing the game as a new player as things stand right now

[b]Dead by Daylight[/b] (DbD) is an impressive crossover of Growing Pains, Horror Iconography, and Multiplayer Retention.

DbD's development - though often plagued by bugs - is constant and ultimately successful in enhancing the experience. It is also one of the only Games-as-a-Service to Not rely on Gacha to fund its further development. Be warned that DbD's Progression Systems & Unexpected Success have entrapped many Toxic Fans - though one should be grateful that [b]Identity V's[/b] underaged audience is largely separate. 

For help finding Teammates, join the Offical DbD Discord: https://discord.gg/deadbydaylight

The game is fun, while has some glitches it is overall fun.

That said if you play as a hunter be prepared for some survivors to complain. They simply complain you camp when you use a hooked survivor as bait, they complain when you do well enough to take out 2 or 3 of them, they complain essentially when they do not win. 

Simple answer survivors, strategy learn it I have had a team of survivors all get out on me by simply playing very well on this. 

I get it , tough game you are not playing against a computer. Just enjoy it. I don't get upset when I am unsuccessful and all 4 exit. I use my tactics, you use yours.

Hab mir das Spiel geholt, weil ich schon öfter davon gelsen und gehört hab und jetzt grad im Angebot ist, also mal par Euros ausgegeben aber eigentlich nur enttäuschungen erlebt...

Folgendes ist Anlass für das negative Review (zu beachten ist das ich nur als Killer gespielt hab):
Das Matchmaking ist unter aller sau... Man wird mit Spielern gematched, die weit aus mehrer Stunden Spielerfahrung haben und das heißt dann wiederrum auch, das sie im Spiel selbst bessere Ausrüstungen und Fähigkeiten mitbringen... heißt im Umkehrschluss als neuer Killer (Level 19 gesamt, Level 5 am Killer) hat man gegen solch Leuten halt 0 Chance, die führen einen halt vor und man darf sich dann auch noch toxic anpöbeln lassen am Ende, auch diese Toxic Community wurde schon oft angesprochen in den Kommentaren

Wenn alle die gleichen Chancen haben und man dann verliert, ist das einfach eine Sache von fehlendem können, wie soll ich aber fehlendes können lernen, wenn die Gegner mit den ich Spiele durch Ingame Perks deutlich besser sind als ich?

Ziel soll es ja nicht sein das ich Spielelang keinen töten kann damit ich irgendwie Blutpunkte farmen kann, bis mir dann mal wieder einer an den Haken geht.... 

Das alles ist für mich Grund genug das Spiel nicht weiter zu spielen...

Why did I buy this in the first place? Why did I think it'd be a good idea to play this at all? What was I thinking when I clicked the "Add to Cart" button? Well, whatever I was thinking, I definitely wasn't thinking correctly.

This game can be fun (when it works). But recently due to endless que times, constant bugs, and a lack of effort from the developer's it's become a chore to play. Until a lot of issues with this game is fixed I wouldn't recommend it to anyone, which is a shame because a year ago I was recommending it to everyone I played games with.

O jogo é legal, tem uma ideia muito boa mas bem mal executada. Parece que os desenvolvedores meio que ''cagam'' pro jogo.

Muita coisa no jogo é boa, a jogabilidade, mapas e personagens por exemplo. O jogo é bem diversificado, alguns mapas parecem iguais mas na maioria são bem bonitos e de alguma forma te fazem aprender a jogar de uma forma diferente de outros mapas. A jogabilidade não é toda travada, o jogo já ganha um ponto positivo comigo por conta disso.

O real problema é que o jogo é todo bugado, lagado e os desenvolvedores nem aí com nada.
Em uma semana eu tive os seguintes problemas:
- Lag compensation, que por sinal é horrível.
- Servidores que simplesmente são péssimo, o host mora quase do lado da minha casa e eu to com 700ms de ping.
- Balanceamento que não existe, eu Rank 19 caindo com killer Rank 2.
- O Killer quita e teu Rank cai porque ele quitou.
- O jogo crasha no meio do loading e te tira Rank também.
- Tu perde level de personagem por causa de crash várias vezes.
- Diferente do Friday eu não caio pra fora do mapa, mas ás vezes acertando ótimos testes de perícia o gerador explode do nada, o killer de acerta de uma distância escrota parece que o jogo ta todo lagado.
- Fiquei sabendo que o sistema de busca anterior era melhor, favor voltarem ao anterior então.

Vale a pena? Sim, mas só se:
- O jogo estiver em promoção.
- Você tiver amigos que joguem.
- Você gostar de jogo desse estilo.
- Você gostar de jogar com 250ms de ping em média (até 250 não tão ruim, mas atrapalha).

Nota: 5, pra não negativar.

[spoiler]Sem fanbase, ambos Friday e Dead by Daylight são bons o real problema do Friday é ser mal investido, o real problema do DbD é ele lucrar muito e não ter o devido investimento.[/spoiler]

Ban for quitting, nothing for tunneling and camping. A lot of gamebraking bugs. Theres no ranking system in this game.
#RevertDBDMovement

I know there are two sides (killer and survivor) and everyone is quarrelling about the other party, but I´ve been playing on both sides for a while now and I need to mention that the killer is far too strong. This game is absolutely not balanced unless you are palying in a squad of four. Well some problems I am looking at:
- There is not way to communicate with survivors during a game (for example voice chat, teamchat, etc.)
- The killer can easily camp at hooks so it gets very hard to help a mate then
- There are so little possibilities to escape from the killer once he noticed you. There are hardly any pellets at some places and yeah (Escape from a thing which is  faster than you AND knows your location due to scars)

Well, yes the game needs some fixed so that it stays fun to play even over a longer period. Good evening


Oh, and have I mentioned that the game is Killer-Host based and sometimes it rubberbands badly?



*Update 10.4: I forgot to say that sometimes when Im playing with a friend we get split in two different lobbies, so we can´t play togheter. Well, I was stuck in the loading screen and my friend had to play in a group of 3. Good night

This game can be the most fun you've ever had in a game or will make you want to break your mouse and keyboard, truly feels like there is no in between. From looping and outplaying tunneling killers, to getting sandbagged by your own potato survivor teammates; if you want a game that is simultaneously frustrating and the best experience behind a monitor then look no more because Dead By Daylight is your game!

The learning curve can be a bit steep on this game, learning how to properly run a sweaty Wraith is hard enough without having to account for broken hit boxes and you being hit after already vaulting a window. There is a ranking system in the game, but it is the luck of the draw if you are placed with other survivors in your skill zone. That being said, fully expect other teammates to let you bully a Leatherface for all five gens just for him to down you at the last second and them open the exit gates and leave you for dead. Not all survivors are that toxic to their own teammates though, some will outright farm you in front of a camping Hillbilly by unhooking you without Borrowed Time and will Dead Hard away as he smacks your little bootyhole and back onto the hook you'll go to feed that hungry Entity that tasty little manflesh. Also, it is pretty much mandatory that at least one person on your team will always be hiding in the corner of the map, not doing anything except hiding and self caring for 20 of the 22 minutes they're in the match. Oh yeah, almost forgot to mention this little bit. Once you think you found a baby killer to bully and feel better about yourself, they'll slap that booty once and down you go because of NOED. Every. Killer. Has. It. Accept this now. Look for the bones, I warn ya now, look for 'em!

But don't think that killer is all fun and games and survivors are running around like chickens with no heads during all the matches, oh no, because when you queue up to learn Nurse you'll end up with a 2000 hour clicky-click SWF group that is going to make you cry and uninstall. Fully condition yourself to accept the fact that after you are completely looped for 4 gens and finally down your first survivor that the fifth gen will pop and they'll jump up with Adrenaline and away they go to the exit gates, where all four survivors will tbag while you stand there, sad and lonely with the Entity displeased. Not every game will go as so, sometimes they bully you with flash lights and half the match will be a dark red and black blob. Other times you'll notice a Nea crawling to a locker after you have downed her and you'll think, "Silly girl, you can't hide in there while you're on the ground." And you'll laugh as you pick her up only for a Scoops Ahoy Steve to jump out and Head On you, and they'll both laugh and run away. Also, Dwight and Claudette have done all five generators by now and all your totems are gone, so no relying on NOED for the at least one kill to stop the Entity from haunting your dreams.

Despite everything I have described, this is still the best Cat and Mouse game out there and 10/10 recommend you pick it up and stay with it. If you ever find yourself in the Fog and you see a Scoops Ahoy Steve with a Purple Flashlight and double battery, tbag twice and look up and down, because that is me and I'm getting ready to make a Huntress DC. Look forward to seeing ya'll in the Fog.
